definitions.definition: a piece of clothing that hangs from the middle part of the body

examples.text: a woman in a blue skirt and white blouse
a green jacket with a matching skirt
The skirt falls just above the knee.
I lifted the hem of my skirt.
She sat down, smoothing her skirt.
She was wearing a short denim skirt.
She wore the plaid skirt that was the uniform of her private school.
I've worn both skirt suits and pant suits to interviews.

definitions.definition: the part of a dress, coat, etc. that hangs below the middle part of the body

examples.text: She tucked up her voluminous skirts to make room for Jane beside her.

definitions.definition: an outer layer that covers and protects the base of a vehicle or machine

examples.text: the rubber skirt around the bottom of a hovercraft

wordOrigin: Middle English: from Old Norse skyrta ‘shirt’; compare with synonymous Old English scyrte, also with short. The verb dates from the early 17th cent.
